title: CEO Secrets: 'The stress of being a boss made my hair fall out'
description: An entrepreneur explains the strategy he devised to protect himself from mental burnout.

title: Oscars 2021: The female directors tackling tough truths
description: Two international film nominees on the personal trials they faced making their hard-hitting films.

title: Letterbox contact: ‘Don’t my birth children have a right to know I’m dying?'
description: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Hanna wanted to tell the twins taken from her at 16 - but had no way of reaching them.

title: The cost of speaking up against China
description: Uyghurs abroad describe a pattern of harassment and intimidation they say is designed to silence them.

title: Coronavirus: How to help health workers' mental health
description: The BBC's Laura Foster gets tips from NHS staff working in the profession.

title: No end in sight for India's protesting farmers
description: Indian farmers are protesting against three new laws they believe will hurt their income.

title: Myanmar coup: The monks divided over the deadly protests
description: Hundreds have been killed in deadly protests since the military took control of the country in February.

title: Speaker Lord Fowler backs calls for National Aids memorial
description: Lord Fowler, the Lord Speaker of the House of Lords, has backed calls for the UK’s first ever National Aids Memorial.

title: London house turned into House of Dreams work of art
description: Artist Stephen Wright has been turning his London house into a work of art since 1998.

title: Scottish election 2021: Leaders' debate fact-checked
description: Reality Check looks at claims about child poverty, renewable energy and mental health.

title: Republic boss Kenny defends team from critics 'wanting to kick us while we're down'
description: Republic of Ireland boss Stephen Kenny fires back at critics "coming out of the woodwork" to "kick us while we're down" at the end of a difficult international window.

title: England U21 job 'utterly impossible' says manager Boothroyd
description: England Under-21 manager Aidy Boothroyd believes his job is "utterly impossible" with his side facing a second successive group stage exit from the European Championships.

title: Gambling apps: a super casino in your pocket
description: There are concerns over the way that gambling companies use the data collected on their customers.

title: Schoolmates Ollie and Jacob on TikTok fame

title: Police 'acted appropriately' at Sarah Everard vigil

title: Captain Houghton to miss England friendlies
description: England will be without captain Steph Houghton and forward Nikita Parris for April's friendlies against France and Canada.

title: Bobby Storey funeral: PPS does not recommend prosecutions
description: The funeral of Bobby Storey attracted 2,000 mourners last June, including Deputy First Minister Michelle O'Neill.

title: Covid in Scotland: 'Stay at home' rule to end on Friday
description: People are being told to "stay local" and remain within their local council area for the following three weeks.

description: Boris Johnson and more than 20 other leaders say another health crisis is a matter of "not if, but when".

title: School abuse: 'Raped schoolgirl 'ignored by teachers'
description: Allegations of sexual abuse are swept under the carpet as private schools prioritise their reputation, pupils claim.

title: Covid: 'Madness' as hundreds descend on Nottingham park
description: Footage on social media shows people brawling at Nottingham Arboretum after restrictions were eased.

title: Losing England players to IPL 'could be danger in the future', says Giles
description: England could lose their best players in the future if they are not allowed to play in the IPL, says director of cricket Ashley Giles.

title: Teen who called himself Hitler sentenced for terror offences
description: The boy, who called himself Hitler, was ordered to tell authorities of his whereabouts for 10 years.

title: Covid: Half of UK has antibodies from vaccination or infection
description: In the oldest people, roughly 90% had signs of protection against the virus in their blood.

title: Suez Canal: Ships begin sailing through cleared waterway
description: Authorities hope to clear the backlog of vessels waiting to use the vital trade route within days.

title: New Champions League format set to be signed off on Wednesday
description: A new Champions League format featuring a 10-match first phase from 2024 is expected to be agreed by Uefa on Wednesday.

title: Easter egg sales 'soar by almost 50%'
description: Spending on Easter eggs is up by almost £50m, research suggests, as people prepare for weekend celebrations.

title: Sir Lenny Henry's open letter urges black Britons to take Covid vaccine
description: The comedian and actor leads stars in an open letter urging black Britons to have the Covid-19 jab.

title: 'Messing around the supply teacher' - Wales protocol breach 'last thing we need', says Saunders
description: Dean Saunders says the disciplining of three Wales players has been an unwanted "distraction" before the World Cup qualifier against the Czech Republic.

title: 'We have your porn stash': The rise of extortionware
description: Hacked firm's IT Manager named and shamed by hackers in extortion technique.

description: Hugging people you don't live with is still off limits, despite lockdown rules easing across the UK.
